sentences.sentence: Pope Francis visits the town of L'Aquilia in central Italy, 13 years after the devastating earthquake.

sentences.sentence: Serbia and Kosovo have reached an identity document deal to facilitate free movement across their borders after tensions soared between Pristina and Belgrade last month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Tripoli's municipal council and the United Nations are calling for an immediate ceasefire in the capital as the death toll continues to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: London and Washington are training Ukrainian soldiers in the use of underwater mining drones to neutralize mines spread across the Black Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: 13 years after the devastating earthquake, which killed over 300 people and left 66,000

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: people homeless, Pope Francis paid a visit to the town of L'Aquiglia in central Italy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Equipped with a hard hat, he was escorted around St. Maximus Cathedral and later delivered the annual Celestinian pardon in the Colle Maggio Basilica.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Speaking afterwards, Francis praised residents for their strength through hardship.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: You, the people of L'Equila, have shown a resilient character, rooted in your Christian and civic tradition, which has enabled you to withstand the shock to the system and immediately begin the courageous and patient work of reconstruction. The St. Maximus Cathedral was one of the many buildings destroyed back in 2019 during the earthquake the quake shocked the Abruzzo region measuring a magnitude of 6.3 it was the first Vatican visit to L'Equileia since Pope Benedict the 16th visited back in 2013 Kosovo and Serbia have ended a dispute over identity documents settling one of visited back in 2013.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Kosovo and Serbia have ended a dispute over identity documents, settling one of the problems between the estranged Balkan neighbours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Last month, Pristina said Serb-issued IDs and vehicle licence plates would no longer be valid on his territory, just as Kosovo-issued ones are not valid in Serbia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But after a series of EU-mediated talks, Brussels says a landmark deal has been reached.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Serbia has agreed to abolish the entry-exit document for Kosovo ID holders and Kosovo has agreed to not introduce them for Serbian ID holders. Kosovo and Serbia using the ID cards. The European Union has received guarantees from Prime Minister Gorti to this end.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The announcement follows a flurry of international efforts to defuse tensions between both sides as NATO peacekeepers stepped up their presence in northern Kosovo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While the license plate matter has yet to be resolved, Brussels has called on the leaders of both territories to work towards a solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Chaos continues on the streets of Tripoli after deadly clashes broke out on Saturday between militia backed by Libya's rivaling administrations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So far 32 people have been killed and 159 injured. The Municipal Council has condemned the parties battling for control of the oil-rich country and has called on the government to bring back stability. This member from the Council of Elders says the civil society institutions in Tripoli appeal to everyone to be calm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We remind them that bloodshed and the intimidation of civilians is forbidden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Legal and criminal prosecutions will affect everyone who was at the cause of the situation in Tripoli. God preserve Libya." When long-time autocrat Miramar Gaddafi was ousted by a NATO-backed uprising in 2011, the North African nation was thrown into turmoil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The United Nations are calling for an immediate ceasefire as fears mount that this escalation could shatter the relative calm the country has enjoyed for most of the past two years and spark a major armed conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The British Royal Navy has begun training a dozen Ukrainian soldiers

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: in the use of underwater minesweeping drones in hopes of securing Ukraine's waters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The training programme is set to last three weeks and trains the soldiers to locate and neutralise Russian mines in the use of underwater minesweeping drones in hopes of securing Ukraine's waters. The training program is set to last three weeks and trains the soldiers to locate and neutralize Russian mines in the Black Sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This underwater drone will be very useful for us to clear the sea area, especially the very critical region close to Odessa region, to find the mines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Along with the training, Ukraine is set to receive six of these underwater drones which use sonar to detect underwater explosives this comes after Russia has been blockading the country's seaports for months paralyzing food and grain exports and causing a sharp spike in food prices around the globe they should be able to clear a main route out of their ports very quickly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That is very important because there is immense pressure, global pressure, to actually start shifting what one could call a grain mountain that's backing up in Ukraine. And it's not just grain, it's also vegetable oil and maize. And this needs to start moving. Demining operations are also underway on land, where bomb disposal teams are constantly finding unexploded shells in mines near Ukraine's front lines and affected civilian areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The demining teams receive dozens of calls every day to get rid of this almost invisible scourge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Poland and the Czech Republic have agreed to protect Slovakia's airspace

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: as the country seeks to retire its 11 Soviet-era fighter planes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The three countries signed the agreement which will allow the Polish and Czech air forces to patrol Slovak skies until the arrival of newer, more modern planes and ensure quick response in case of air border violations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Russian MiG-29s will be replaced by American F-16s and are set to be delivered by 2024.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Slovak Defense Minister, Jaroslav Nad, said that the decommissioned fleet may be donated to its neighbor Ukraine, who is currently at war with Russia under certain conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile Poland has signed an almost 6 billion euro arms contract with South Korea in an effort to increase its defense and deterrence capabilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In what is thought to be South Korea's biggest ever arms deal, 180 K2 tanks and over 200 K9 howitzers will be supplied to the Eastern European country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Polish soldiers are set to visit Seoul in October to familiarize themselves with the equipment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Northern Serbia has become the epicenter of a migrant crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: More than 10,000 refugees, mostly from Asia and North Africa, have made the journey to the Balkan country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Many are attempting to enter the European Union from the city of Subotica, on the border with Hungary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Despite a four-metre high fence built by Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orb√°n in 2015, border agency Frontex says more than 70,000 migrants have been detected on this border route since the beginning of January, three times the number of refugees seen in the same period last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While Hungarian authorities have been successful in pushing back some of the migrants, many are determined to find a better life further west.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: According to Austria's Ministry for the Interior, nearly 42,000 people have lodged asylum applications since the start of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At least six people have been killed in the Netherlands after a lorry ploughed off-road and into a community barbecue on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The incident took place south of Rotterdam and has left seven more in hospital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: place south of Rotterdam and has left seven more in hospital. Police say the driver, a 46-year-old Spaniard, was not driving under the influence of alcohol when he lost control of his vehicle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, an investigation is underway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: India demolished two residential high-rise buildings outside New Delhi on Sunday

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: in a dramatic spectacle carried out on live television.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The 100-metre-high buildings were subject to corruption, containing between them nearly 1,000 apartments that were never inhabited over nine years. 3,700 kilograms of explosives were used, becoming India's biggest demolition to date.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Prince Charles has guest-edited an edition of the British African Caribbean newspaper The Voice, which celebrates its 40 year anniversary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The special edition is set to be released on September 1st.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The publication includes an exclusive interview with black British actor Idris Elba, who starred in The Wire and several Marvel movies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Elba expresses his gratitude to the Prince of Wales, saying that a grant from Charles' charity changed his life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Prince Charles says that over the last four decades, with all the enormous changes they have witnessed, Britain's only surviving black newspaper has become an institution and a crucial part of the fabric of British society.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: and a crucial part of the fabric of British society.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Music, dance, food and a parade are making their way through the streets of Notting Hill once again, as its carnival is back in person for the first time since 2019.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The famous Notting Hill Carnival is the second largest in the world and is back after going temporarily online during the first two years of the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The event is famous for its celebration of Caribbean culture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Its origins date back to the 1950s, when activists began organizing gatherings after racially motivated attacks in the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This year, organizers are planning a 72-second silence to remember those who died in the Grenfell fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The cost of living crisis is also expected to impact this year's Carnival, as organizers claim that some people could not afford its stable extravagant outfits, and some bands were unable to attend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Despite this setback, millions are expected to take part in this year's Carnival.
